Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Although \Al*though"\, conj. [All + though; OE. al thagh.] Grant all this; be it that; supposing that; notwithstanding; though. [1913 Webster]
Although all shall be offended, yet will not I. --Mark xiv. 29. [1913 Webster]
Syn: {Although}, {Though}.
Usage: Although, which originally was perhaps more emphatic than though, is now interchangeable with it in the sense given above. Euphonic consideration determines the choice. [1913 Webster]
although adv : despite the fact that; "even though she knew the answer, she did not respond" [syn: {though}, {tho'}]
